both mothers and infants [61,127–132]. One of the most prevalent causes of anaemia is iron deficiency, which 
may be combined with deficiencies of folate, vitamin B12, riboflavin and/or vitamin A [127]. Anaemia during 
preconception and early gestation is associated with impaired fetal development, preterm delivery and low birth 
weight [128–130]. Systemic iron deficiency and hypoferremia are observed more in obese women compared 
with women of healthy body weight [133].
